intro: Ptelea neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for wildlife. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and canyons. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
